section.p: The public or private organization that is responsible for payment for health care expenses. Payers may be insurance companies or self-insured employers.

ol.li:
Contains exactly one [1..1] address with data type Address
The full address of the organization (e.g. 112 Main St, Suite 23, Cambridge, MA, 02140-3314, USA) it is broken down into its constituent parts (street address line 1, street address line 2, city name, state or province code, postal code, country code)

Contains exactly one [1..1] id with data type Id
A unique identifier that is used to identify the payer. For example Medicare assigns an identifier to a payer, Blue Cross/Blue Shield assigns an identifier to a payer. 270/271 p 343, 358 example

Contains exactly one [1..1] name with data type String
The name of the organization (e.g. Harvard Pilgrim Health Care)

Contains exactly one [1..1] phone with data type Telecommunications
The phone number for a person at their office location. First choice for business related contacts during business hours.
Contains exactly one [1..1] pointOfContact with data type Person Name
Contains exactly one [1..1] healthPlan, where its type is Health Plan
Contains zero or more [0..*] organization, where its type is Organization
Contains zero or more [0..*] PayerOrAgent, where its type is Processor
